summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 6, 2019, discussing logistical planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email indicates the Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting the affidavit, with plans to fly out on August 11 and conduct the search over 1-3 days.

persons.name: SSA Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FBI New York
persons.context: Author of the initial email coordinating the search warrant operation for Epstein's island, requesting availability from team members.

events.title: Expected warrant swearing in St. Thomas
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting a search warrant affidavit for Epstein's island, with the warrant expected to be sworn out in St. Thomas.

events.title: Planned FBI departure for island search
events.description: The FBI team plans to fly out on the FBI Q400 plane to execute the search warrant on Epstein's private island.

events.title: Planned search of Epstein's island
events.description: The search of Epstein's island off St. Thomas, managed by the Evidence Response Team (ERT), is expected to take 1-3 days.

events.title: Planned return travel
events.description: The FBI team plans to travel home from the search operation.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas in August 2019.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad in New York was coordinating the search operation.
The search was planned to be executed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT) and was expected to last 1-3 days.
The operational timeline was tentative, with plans to fly out on August 11, 2019, and return on August 15, 2019.
This document shows active FBI investigation into Epstein's activities shortly before his death in August 2019.
